result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lillian Denise Taylor

11:01 AM Defendant Lillian Denise Taylor appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by phone for Lillian Denise Taylor.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Mayer notes that Deft was just arrested last night.
Court will not address bond today.
Court - Trial is scheduled for next week, but notes that a more serious Trial is scheduled for the same days and does not believe this case will proceed.
State notes an offer was extended on this case and does not know where Defense stands on global resolution.
Atty Mayer is standby counsel for a case proceeding in Branch 2 next week also and given new circumstance, would like to communicate w/Deft and DA's Office regarding possible resolution.
Court will remove Jury dates for next week.
